comments:
Created a new project, released that to a (new) cvs server. When i try to
release new changes (even to a single file) it will first compare the complete
workspace to the cvs repository, and then crash when opening the sync view.

I'm using 20020307. This is the exception in the log file:

Log: Thu Mar 14 16:22:17 CET 2002

*** Bug 11361 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

I am unable to reproduce this so far. Could you answer the following questions 
to help me narrow down the problem:
1. Was the project created at a custom location
2. What CVS server version are you running against
3. What is your repository path, the module path in the repository and the name 
of the file (I don't need the actual names if they are sensitive but I need a 
reasonably close approximation - same length, same general makeup). You can 
look in the CVS tab of the project properties for the repository path and the 
module path.

My replies are prepended with 'SJG:' for clarity.

1. Was the project created at a custom location

  SJG: Yes, I run Eclipse with -data C:\Transgenomic\workspace, and the CVS 
project is named Navigator. 

2. What CVS server version are you running against

   SJG: CVSNT v1.11.1.1 (build 27). It has been determined newer versions of 
CVSNT are incompatible with Team2.0.

3. What is your repository path,
   SJG: C:\CVS (in Eclipse, I use /c//cvs which is understood by CVSNT)

the module path in the repository
   SJG: Navigator 

and the name of the file (I don't need the actual names if they are sensitive 
but I need a reasonably close approximation - same length, same general makeup).

   SJG: The files are typically of the form 
com.transgenomic.navigator.blah.blah.file.java. We have ~48 packages that are 
displayed in Eclipse's Packages view. The project also contains a 'lib' 
directory with ~14 different binary files (.jar and .zip). 

I am not the original submitter of this issue, but hope this helps.

The currently supported format for specifying CVSNT repository roots in Eclipse 
is C:\cvsroot. The format /c//cvsroot is not supported. If I understand you 
correctly, this format is supported by CVSNT?

From SJG:

  I wasn't sure if I should keep adding this to the bug list or not... I can
if you desire. But yes, the format /c//cvs is legal in cvsnt. This is
typically done to allow non-windows clients access to a cvsnt repository,
where the unix client doesn't understand "c:\". Let me try to switch this
real quick and see if the internal errors go away... well, currently I'm in
sync with the repository so I'm not getting internal errors. I will continue
to use this for a while and see if the errors come back. Thanks!

SJG
Marking later, we don't support CVSNT (although we welcome patches :)  )
It appears that the path was the problem. If not, please reopen.
